location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is an update on the expedition against Carrack [Kharg] and covers several things:Sheik Ise [Sheikh ‘Isa] has been ordered to prepare the Bushire fleet for transporting the Persian troops;the Chaub's [Banu Ka‘b] gallivats (a type of large boat) and some of those from Ormuse [Hormuz] are believed to also be joining the expedition;the sick and wounded have still not left for Bombay due to a lack of provisions and no available vessel;a readiness to withdraw from Bushire should no Persian troops have been sent by the time Skipp returns from Shiraz.
